main event: Several UFO sightings were reported in the North Pacific and Hawaiian Islands in 1959, including observations of fast-moving, bright, cylindrical objects and bright metallic, elliptical objects, as well as erratic flight characteristics and high-speed acceleration and deceleration.
interesting points: Objects were observed at speeds up to 8,000 knots and altitudes ranging from 10,000 to 45,000 feet.
Pilots observed an unknown object with a bright, pulsating, greenish-white light that emitted no sound and rapidly ascended to 50,000 feet.
A 'flying cigar' emitting a reddish glow at a high altitude was reported over Brindisi, Italy.
Reports described sightings of spherical, oval, and circular UFOs with no visible means of propulsion.
Observers noted that the objects did not resemble known aircraft, satellites, or natural phenomena and exhibited unusual lighting and maneuvering behaviors.
sighted object: various unidentified aerial objects, including bright metallic, elliptical, and spherical objects
witnesses: USAF pilots of 85th Fighter Interceptor Squadron, commercial airline pilot and co-pilot, observers from Southern Oregon College, and others
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
